arm_group.description: Half Carbohydrate and Half Non-Caloric Konjac Noodles - 122.5g Konjac
Non-Caloric Konjac Noodles (viscous gel meal) - 240g Konjac

brief_summary.textblock:
To evaluate the effects of Konjac on satiety and subsequent food intake in healthy
      individuals.

clinical_study.brief_title: Satiety Study of a Carbohydrate Meal to a Highly Viscous Gel Meal

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Men and women

          -  Age 18-65 years

          -  Having a BMI of 18.5 - 25 kg/m2

          -  No presence of major disease

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Known history of liver or kidney disease, diabetes, hypertension, stroke or
             myocardial infarctions, thyroid disease, gastrointestinal disease, AIDS or
             AIDS-related complications; subjects using prescription medications or Natural Health
             Products; Subjects will be excluded if they have any condition which, in the opinion
             of the investigator, might jeopardize the health and safety of the subject or study
             personnel, or adversely affect the study results

intervention.description: Replacement of carbohydrate noodles with non-caloric Konjac noodles (viscous gel meal)

clinical_study.official_title: Comparing the Satiety Scores of a Carbohydrate Meal to a Meal of Equal Volume in Which Half of the Volume is Replaced With a Highly Viscous Gel.

overall_official.affiliation: Risk Factor Modification Centre - St. Michael's Hospital

primary_outcome.description:
Objective satiety will be measured through subsequent food intake.
At each visit, participants will consume a pre-weighed snack (wafer cookies) that will be administered ad libitum at 90mins after consumption of the test meal. Subsequent food intake will be calculated by weighing the amount of the snack food left after consumption.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: At each visit, participants will record their subjective satiety ratings using a 100 mm visual analogue scale and these rating will be combined into a total subjective appetite score using the formula (Q1+Q2+(100-Q3)+Q4)/4.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Caregiver, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Prevention
